intro: Anemopaegma longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed anemopaegma, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and delicate, umbrella-like inflorescences. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Anemopaegma longipes thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
